Detailed Description

BoundingBox, implementation of an axis aligned boundingbox.

bool BoundingBox::clip ( Vector3 &  source,
Vector3 &  extent,
float  bloat = 0.f 
) const

This method clips the given line segment to this bounding box.

i.e. it makes it start and end inside it. For this calculation, the bounding box is first expanded by a bloat amount in all directions.

Returns:
false if the line segment doesn't intersects the box at all (like intersectsLine)

Returns:
distance to the point

void BoundingBox::expandSymmetrically ( const Vector3 &  v  ) 

This method expands the bounding box by the given amounts in each direction.

Empty bounding boxes are left alone. Offseting inwards too much can make, for example, min_.x > max_.x which in turns makes the box inside out as you'd expect.

void BoundingBox::expandSymmetrically ( float  dx,
float  dy,
float  dz 
)

This method expands the bounding box by the given amounts in each direction.

Empty bounding boxes are left alone. Offseting inwards too much can make, for example, min_.x > max_.x which in turns makes the box inside out as you'd expect.

void BoundingBox::transformBy ( const Matrix &  transform  ) 

This method transforms this bounding box by the input transform.

The new bounding box is set to the bounding box of the rotated box.
